post.content:
Here's a little slice of golf history that you might enjoy.


Why do golf courses have 18 holes - not 20, or 10, or an even dozen?


During a discussion among the club's membership board at St. Andrews
in 1858, a senior member pointed out that it takes exactly 18 shots
to polish off a fifth of Scotch. By limiting himself to only one shot
of Scotch per hole, the Scot figured a round of golf was finished
when the Scotch ran out.


Now you know.
post.title: Why a round of golf is 18 holes
